newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot LPGs mostly stable in dead trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot LPGs mostly stable in dead trade.

text.p: U.S. spot LPG prices were mostly stable in very quiet trade late on Thursday as many sellers refused to step down with a tumbling Merc, players said.
"It's one of those unsettled markets and no one wants to do anything," said a Mont Belvieu trader.
In the Gulf Coast, Mont Belvieu, Texas, propane remained steady between 48.75 cents and 49.00 cents a gallon, after falling one cent at midday.
In Conway, Kansas, material was also steady at 45.25/45.50 cents.
"It's just dead this afternoon," said one Conway trader. "All the buyers have stepped away."
NYMEX October crude oil futures ended 35 cents down at $23.54 a barrel and heating oil was down 1.1 cents at 66.77 cents.
-- Laney Salisbury New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
